page.title: 17WILDLIFE DOWNLAND MINAL
page.content:
Some evidence of wild animals was apparent, and those actually seen - or identified from tracks and droppings - include badgers, fallow deer, field-mice, foxes, hares, hedgehogs, moles and rabbits.
The woodland and hedgerows provides a settled habitat for the large variety of birds, and the latter would obviously offer a large variety of winter food. Parts of the woodland are used as pheasant praeserves, and this environment induces many wild birds to spend all,or part, of the year there. One sees blackbirds, blue-tits, chaffinches, collared doves, great tits,, hedge sparrows, linnets, long-tailed tits, partridges, pheasantas, rooks, starlings,swallows, wagtails, wood pigeons and wrens.
